title: Reuters Sports Schedule at 0001 GMT on Wednesday
text: February 19, 2018 / 3:28 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago Reuters Sports Schedule at 0001 GMT on Wednesday Reuters Staff Reuters sports schedule at 0001 GMT on Wednesday: WINTER OLYMPICS Women’s downhill takes centre stage - without Shiffrin PYEONGCHANG, South Korea - The women’s downhill is the highlight of seven medal events but it will take place without American Mikaela Shiffrin, who is skipping the race to concentrate on the rearranged combined. It is also the short programme in the women’s figure skating and there are golds to be won in speed skating, cross country, freestyle skiing cross, and bobsleigh. It is the women’s bronze medal match and men’s quarter-finals in a big day of ice hockey. (OLYMPICS-2018/ PIX, TV, expect throughout) SOCCER Champions League, last 16, first leg (1945) Sevilla v Manchester United Shakhtar Donetsk v Roma Sevilla aiming for first Champions League quarter-final spot Sevilla bid to reach the quarter-finals for the first time when they host Manchester United in their last 16, first leg in Seville. (SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-SEV-MUN/(PIX, TV), expect by 2145 GMT/5:30 PM ET, by Richard Martin, 300 words400 words) Shakhtar look for another Italian scalp at home to Roma Shakhtar Donetsk welcome Roma in their Champions League last 16, first leg game in Kharkiv having qualified from their group at the expense of another Italian team Napoli. (SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-SHK-ROM/ (PIX, TV), 400 words) Europa League CSKA Moscow v Red Star Belgrade CSKA and Red Star bid for last 16 spot MOSCOW - CSKA Moscow welcome Red Star Belgrade meet in the return leg of their Europa League last 32 tie with all to play for after the first game finished goalless. (SOCCER-EUROPA-CSK-RSB/ (PIX), expect from 1900 GMT/4 PM ET, 300 words) La Liga Leganes v Real Madrid (1830) Real visit local rivals Leganes with an eye on third spot Real Madrid visit local rivals Leganes, who famously knocked them out of the King’s Cup this season, with Zinedine Zidane’s side looking to move up to third in La Liga with a victory. (SOCCER-SPAIN-LEG-MAD/(PIX), expect by 2030 GMT/3:30 PM ET, by Richard Martin, 200 words) CRICKET Hot Australia face New Zealand in T20 Tri-Series final AUCKLAND - Red-hot Australia, unbeaten in the round-robin phase of the Trans-Tasman T20 Tri-Series competition, play the final against New Zealand, who limped into the showpiece match on net run rate after they lost to England by two runs in the last match. (CRICKET-T20-TRI/, expect by 1030 GMT/5:30 AM ET, 400 words) South Africa v India, second Twenty20, Pretoria India look to wrap up T20 series against South Africa PRETORIA - India can maintain their limited overs dominance over South Africa and claim the Twenty20 series in the second of the three matches. (CRICKET-T20-ZAF-IND/, expect from 1600 GMT/11 AM ET, by Nick Said, 400 words) RUGBY Six Nations Scotland name team for England clash Scotland coach Gregor Townsend holds a news conference after naming his team to face unbeaten England in their Six Nations Calcutta Cup clash at Murrayfield on Saturday. (RUGBY-UNION-NATIONS-SCO/, expect from 1200 GMT/7 AM ET, 400 words) Italy name team to take on France MARSEILLE - Italy name their team as coach Conor O‘Shea hols a news conference ahead of Friday’s Six Nations clash against France in Marseille. (RUGBY-UNION-NATIONS-ITA/, expect from 1300 GMT/8 AM ET, 400 words) (Asia desk editor: Greg Stutchbury)
